title: cellxgene_census
description: Query CellxGene Census or user-specified TileDBSoma object, and eventually fetch cell and gene metadata or/and expression counts.

inputs.title: Inputs
inputs.description: Arguments related to the input (aka query) dataset.

input_database.description: Type: `string`, default: `CellxGene`, example: `s3://`. Full input database S3 prefix URL
input_database.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `CellxGene`, example: `s3://`. Full input database S3 prefix URL. Default: CellxGene Census

modality.description: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to store the output in
modality.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `rna`. Which modality to store the output in.

cellxgene_release.description: Type: `string`, default: `2023-05-15`. CellxGene Census release date
cellxgene_release.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `2023-05-15`. CellxGene Census release date. More information: https://chanzuckerberg.github.io/cellxgene-census/cellxgene_census_docsite_data_release_info.html

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file.

species.description: Type: `string`, default: `homo_sapiens`, example: `homo_sapiens`, choices: ``homo_sapiens`, `mus_musculus``. Specie(s) of interest
species.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `homo_sapiens`, example: `homo_sapiens`, choices: ``homo_sapiens`, `mus_musculus``. Specie(s) of interest. If not specified, Homo Sapiens will be queried.

cell_query.description: Type: `string`, example: `is_primary_data == True and cell_type_ontology_term_id in ['CL:0000136', 'CL:1000311', 'CL:0002616'] and suspension_type == 'cell'`. The query for selecting the cells as defined by the cellxgene census schema
cell_query.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `is_primary_data == True and cell_type_ontology_term_id in ['CL:0000136', 'CL:1000311', 'CL:0002616'] and suspension_type == 'cell'`. The query for selecting the cells as defined by the cellxgene census schema.

cells_filter_columns.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `dataset_id:tissue:assay:disease:cell_type`, multiple_sep: `":"`. The query for selecting the cells as defined by the cellxgene census schema
cells_filter_columns.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `dataset_id:tissue:assay:disease:cell_type`, multiple_sep: `":"`. The query for selecting the cells as defined by the cellxgene census schema.

min_cells_filter_columns.description: Type: `double`, example: `100`. Minimum of amount of summed cells_filter_columns cells
min_cells_filter_columns.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `100`. Minimum of amount of summed cells_filter_columns cells

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.

param_list.description: Type: `string`, example: `my_params.yaml`. Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel
param_list.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `my_params.yaml`. Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. A `param_list` can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml blob.

* A list of maps (as-is) where the keys of each map corresponds to the arguments of the pipeline. Example: in a `nextflow.config` file: `param_list: [ ['id': 'foo', 'input': 'foo.txt'], ['id': 'bar', 'input': 'bar.txt'] ]`.
* A csv file should have column names which correspond to the different arguments of this pipeline. Example: `--param_list data.csv` with columns `id,input`.
* A json or a yaml file should be a list of maps, each of which has keys corresponding to the arguments of the pipeline. Example: `--param_list data.json` with contents `[ {'id': 'foo', 'input': 'foo.txt'}, {'id': 'bar', 'input': 'bar.txt'} ]`.
* A yaml blob can also be passed directly as a string. Example: `--param_list "[ {'id': 'foo', 'input': 'foo.txt'}, {'id': 'bar', 'input': 'bar.txt'} ]"`.

When passing a csv, json or yaml file, relative path names are relativized to the location of the parameter file. No relativation is performed when `param_list` is a list of maps (as-is) or a yaml blob.
